entry.title: Pashinyan arrives in Turkey for historic visit

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan arrives in Turkey for historic visit
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan arrived in Turkey at the invitation of President Recep Tayyip Erdoƒüan for a historic working visit. üìç Armenia and Russia could lose around $6 billion in mutual trade turnover by the end of 2025, Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexey Overchuk warned. üìç Who wants Iran destroyed & why? https://youtu.be/IH53TQYTlRA?si=7v8QAgUvOIQjm1cl

media:group.media:title: Billionaire Samvel Karapetyan arrested for alleged power usurpation
media:group.media:description:
üìç Russian-Armenian billionaire Samvel Karapetyan has been placed in pre-trial detention for two months following his arrest last night. üìç Families of missing persons from the Karabakh War are protesting in Yerevan after the dismissal of Armenia‚Äôs security chief. They fear the dismissal will derail efforts to locate their loved ones. üìç Armenia has formally accused Russia of interfering in its internal affairs after a Kremlin-backed TV attack on Pashinyan. üìç Business Weekly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g_pJ5DdA6U0

media:group.media:title: Who wants Iran destroyed & why?
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian covers the geopolitical shock of Israel‚Äôs attack on Iran, and what the unfolding war means for Armenia. Hacopian outlines the key developments, including the purported use of Azerbaijani territory for Israeli drone strikes, the likely goals behind the attacks, and the potential for a wider regional conflict. He also examines how Iran‚Äôs instability could affect Armenia‚Äôs security, economy, and border situation, raising concerns about delayed imports, possible refugee flows, and increased threats from Azerbaijan.

entry.title: Armenia-Iran Border: Iranians Speak About War and Their Families

media:group.media:title: Armenia-Iran Border: Iranians Speak About War and Their Families
media:group.media:description:
"We have complicated this simple life." The flow of Iranian citizens to Armenia continues. Uncertainty, loved ones left on the other side of the border, and an emptying Tehran: this is how Iranians who have crossed the Agarak checkpoint describe the situation. Some, despite obstacles, are going in the other direction- returning to Iran to be with their relatives.
